client.java:18: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if(Trogame = 1) ^ client.java:20: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if(Trogame = 2) ^ client.java:22: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if(Trogame = 3) ^ client.java:24: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if(Trogame = 4) ^

item.title: Help on error
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

public boolean Trogame = 0;

You have declared a boolean as an integer.

public int Trogame = 0;

Fixed code ^

public void TroMini(){
if(Trogame = 1);
SummonNewNPC(1106);
if(Trogame = 2);
SummonNewNPC(1118);
if(Trogame = 3);
SummonNewNPC(1115);
if(Trogame = 4);
SummonNewNPC(1125);
}

That wouldn’t even work.

public void TroMini(){
if(Trogame = 1)
    SummonNewNPC(1106);
if(Trogame = 2)
    SummonNewNPC(1118);
if(Trogame = 3)
    SummonNewNPC(1115);
if(Trogame = 4)
    SummonNewNPC(1125);
}

Fixed Code ^

Read full topic
